### ReturnShipments Interface This interface should be used to find return shipments which have been handed over to the carrier for final delivery to the partner. At the beginning of the process the customer has to create a return label for his shipment (to be returned). This is the trigger for a continuous query of the tracking status with its specific carrier. You can use the GET endpoints to retrieve information of your return shipments in the OTTO Market. ### Changelog This changelog will document all relevant changes in our interface.

tags.name: Returns-V3
tags.description:
### Returns Interface After you have sent the product to the customer, but the customer has unfortunately decided not to keep it, this Returns Interface allows you to report the return. In principle, you will accept a return, so that we can trigger the customer payment immediately. It would be great if you would also inform us about the condition of the return and the reason for acceptance. Accept reason is a set of values to tell us why you are accepting the return.
This will help us understand and if possible, the business reason behind accept returns.
Some examples of accept reasons could be "RETURN_RECEIVED", "CANCEL_REQUEST_BY_CUSTOMER", "SHIPMENT_LOST", "RETURN_LOST", etc.
In the rare case (e.g. if the return does not correspond to the correct article) that you do not want to accept a return, you also have the option to reject the return.
In this case we would like to receive a reason in addition to the condition of the return. Reject reason is a set of values where you can tell us why you are rejecting the return. This will help us understand and if possible, reduce "bad" returns. Some examples of reject reasons could be "WRONG_ITEM", "EXCHANGE", "ITEM_NOT_IN_THE_PARCEL", etc.

We expect the following values for the condition: * A for "in original packaging" * B for "in mint condition" * C for "slightly used" * D for "heavily used" * E for "mistake (Delivery incomplete, not available,...)" If you have already accepted a return, it cannot be rejected again afterwards.
However, if you feel you have changed your mind about a rejected return, you still have the option to accept the return afterwards. ### Changelog This changelog will document all relevant changes in our interface.
Kudos to https://keepachangelog.com/de/1.0.0/ | Date | Description | |------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | 2024-03-18 | We are introducing API v3 in which **return rejection reason should be one of the enum values; rather than a free text earlier**.

From v3, return acceptance can also have a reason as an optional enum value.

**API version v2 will be supported till 30th September, 2024.

After this date, the returns interface will reject requests via v2 and only v3 will be supported. Please do the necessary changes to migrate to v3 version.** |

tags.name: Receipts-V3
tags.description:
### Receipts Interface Using this API, partners and/or their service provider can get all receipts generated in their name in context of B2C processes to document the billing process on OTTO Market. â  **Please for your own interest, hand over all receipt types you are interested in using the new list parameter receiptTypes, so that OTTO Market could add new receipt types without side effects for your own processes.**
**Using this option you can decide by your own when to incorporate new receipt types in your own processes.**
**Please do not use the possibility of calls without specifying the receiptTypes anymore.** All receipt types currently exists in live environment: - **PURCHASE**
A purchase receipt (also called an invoice) documents what prices charged by the customer at the time of sales, taking into account granted discounts. The receipt contains information per order, partner and shipment. It is created when items are shipped to the customer. Each item or service is invoiced exactly once. So that there can be more than one receipt per order. Shipping costs are charged only once per partner and order and are shown only once in case of partial shipments of an order. Surcharges levied by a payment provider on the customer when using special payment conditions are not part of the receipts of OTTO Market. - **REFUND**
We distinguish different types of reimbursement documents. A refund receipt documents the a customer's claim of reimbursement. This receipt is currently created when returned items are accepted. A refund receipt normally contains at least an item or service. In very rare cases, however, refund receipts can also be created in context of the cancellation process to repay shipping costs only billed for full returns. Earlier partial refunds are taken into account. - **PARTIAL_REFUND**
We distinguish different types of reimbursement documents. A partial refund receipt documents a customer's claim of reimbursement. Different reasons are possible for partner to trigger such a receipt. For example a partial refund of an item price as a gesture of goodwill to avoid returns On all documents you will usually find - item/service details - shipped quantities - delivery costs - payment details - customer details - partner details Some details can only be found on the pdf documents. These include for example: - Company logo of OTTO (as operator of OTTO Market) - Company details of financial service providers - Contact details of OTTO (as relation center operator for customer inquiries and complaints) General information: - Pdf documents are only generated once and do not change over time. - When a pdf is generated, dates are printed on the pdf documents in format DD.MM.YYYY in time zone (CET/CEST) from Germany. - Currently, we provide receipts that are up to 4 years old. We could not guarantee this forever, so it would be good, if you plan to get receipts always periodically. Below you find the end points which can use to retrieve this information from the Receipts API. ### Interested in some more details?
Rough class diagram of JSON representation of receipt (Click to Expand) â  This class diagram only shows the main objects to show the general structure. More information about the missing objects can be found in the field description. * **Receipt** - Collection of all details of a receipt. A receipt can have different receiptTypes * **Customer** - Customer details * **Address** - Address entered by customer during the order process. Recipient can be a person or a pickup point. * **Partner** - Partner details when generating the receipt * **LineItems** - Block of receipt line items * **ItemPosition** - Representation of an item
Never used in context of receipts of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **DeliveryCost** - Representation of delivery cost like delivery fee or freight surcharge
Never used in context of receipts of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **ServicePosition** - Representation of a service
Never used in context of receipts of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **ItemPartialRefundPosition** - Reduction of an item price granted by a receipt of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **PriceModification** - PriceModification objects represent price increases and decreases of individual line item objects.
Currently we only know decreases granted instandly or at a later point in time.
On the pdf documents increases and decreases do not necessarily have to be shown on the same line. If there is a discrepancy, it is visible by different line numbers of this object and the parent line item object.
Different PriceModification objects of same type are possible. * **ServicePartialRefundPosition** - Reduction on a service price granted by a receipt of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **DeliveryFeePartialRefundPosition** - Reduction on delivery costs granted by a receipt of receiptType PARTIAL_REFUND * **Payment** - Payment details * **TotalsReduction** - Reduction on receipt level * **Shipment** - Additional information of shipment
### Changelog This changelog will document all relevant changes in our interface.
Kudos to https://keepachangelog.com/de/1.0.0/ | Date | Description | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | | 2023-01-11 | We are proudly introducing our receipts API v3 with a lot of changes compared to v2, that we will describe here. **v2 will be supported until 11th of July 2023.** After this date, the receipts interface will reject requests via v2.

**Changed**

tags.name: ShippingProfiles-V1
tags.description:
### Partner endpoints for shipping profiles

ShippingProfiles can now be created, edited, and deleted using the ShippingProfiles-API. 
Additionally, the API offers detailed control over delivery times, for example Cut-Off-Time and WorkingDays ensuring precise and efficient management of shipping details.

### Changelog

This changelog will document all relevant changes in our Partner interfaces.

| Date       | Description                                           |
|------------|-------------------------------------------------------|

tags.name: Availability-V1
tags.description:
### Partner endpoints for available quantities and linking shipping profiles

The Availability API allows for the assignment of shipping profiles at the SKU level.
Moreover, it enables the adjustment of processing times for individual SKUs or multiple SKUs simultaneously, providing flexible and efficient management of product availability. 
The Quantities-V2 API will be integrated into the Availability-V1 API at the end of March and the entire inventory will be managed through it afterwards. 
This allows partners and service providers to update the available quantity for a specific SKU (up to 200 SKUs per request). The available quantity can be any integer value >= 0.

### Changelog

This changelog will document all relevant changes in our Partner interfaces.

| Date       | Description            |
|------------|------------------------|
| 2024-08-05 | Replaces Quantities v2 |
